name: sweet bunny
notes:
materials
to make 2 bunnies, you will need...
- 1 skein of purl soho’s [sweetgrass][1], 65% organic cotton and 35% superfine alpaca, undyed. each skein of fingering-weight yarn is 437 yards/ 100 grams; approximately 195 yards required per bunny.
- a set of five us 1½ (2.75 mm) [double pointed needles][2]
- removable [stitch markers][3], including one unique
- scrap yarn
- purl soho’s [pom pom maker set][4], small + large. we used the small size with the 1-inch trim guide.

you will also need a [sweet bunny finishing bundle][5], which includes what you need to stuff and finish 2 bunnies (but not the yarn!)...
- a [linen quill color card][6] in kettle black for the eyes
- a linen quill color card in lychee pink for the nose and mouth
- dmc embroidery floss in ecru, for tying and attaching pom pom tail
- poly stuffing

gauge
32 stitches and 44 rows = 4 inches in stockinette stitch

size
- finished circumference around widest part of body: approximately 6 inches, stretching up to 8 inches, stuffed
- finished height: approximately 11 inches

designed by purl soho designer, [hiromi glover][7]. see even more of hiromi’s work [on her instagram][8]!
